items.title: Van Poortvliet shines as Leicester dominate Quins
items.summary: Jack van Poortvliet scores a stunning solo try as Leicester Tigers cruise past struggling Harlequins and move up to fourth.

items.title: Rod Stewart Rips Into â€˜Draft Dodgerâ€™ Donald Trump for Insulting NATO Troops inÂ Afghanistan
items.summary: â€œI may just be a humble rock star, but Iâ€™m also a Knight of the realm, and I have my opinions," he said.
items.body: Sir Rod Stewart is firing back at Donald Trump. On Friday (Jan. 23), the 81-year-old rock legend criticized the president in a video shared on social media after Trump suggested that NATO troops avoided the front lines during the war in Afghanistan. Related Rod Stewart Extends One Last Time Tour With 15 Additional 2026 U.S. Dates Phil Collins Reveals He's Under 24-Hour Care, But Feeling 'Totally Mobile & Healthy' in Update Rod Stewart to Receive Lifetime Achievement Award & Perform at 2025 American Music Awards â€œI may just be a humble rock star, Iâ€™m also a Knight of the realm and I have my opinions,â€ Stewart said in the Instagram clip. â€œI was born just after the war (World War II) and I have great respect for our armed forces that fought and gave us our freedom. So it hurts me badly, deeply, when I read that the draft dodger Trump has criticized our troops in Afghanistan for not being on the front line.â€ Stewart went on to highlight the sacrifices made by U.K. service members, noting that more than 400 British personnel served during the prolonged conflict in Afghanistan. “Think of their parents. Think about it,” the singer-songwriter câ€¦

items.title: Fulham winner was 'extra special' - Wilson
items.summary: In-form Fulham midfielder Harry Wilson speaks to Final Score's Jason Mohammed after scoring a late winner against Brighton in the Premier League.

items.title: From 'impossible task' to 'hope' - will West Ham stay up?
items.summary: Back-to-back Premier League wins have taken West Ham United to within two points of 17th.

items.title: Ref's 'courageous' call denies Man City penalty on Premier League debut
items.summary: Referee Farai Hallam was praised for choosing not to award Manchester City a penalty against Wolves on his Premier League debut.

items.title: Guehi has something special - Guardiola
items.summary: Manchester City boss Pep Guardiola is really pleased with how new signing Marc Guehi played on his debut for his new team in their 2-0 win over Wolves.

items.title: Bristol edge past Exeter in rainstorm to go third
items.summary: Torrential rain meant that only eleven points were scored all match.

items.title: â€˜Saturday Night Liveâ€™: How to Watch the Variety Comedy Show Online Without Cable forÂ Free
items.summary: Teyana Taylor hosts, while Geese performs as musical guest on Saturday, Jan. 24.
items.body: All products and services featured are independently chosen by editors. However, Billboard may receive a commission on orders placed through its retail links, and the retailer may receive certain auditable data for accounting purposes. Golden Globe-winner Teyana Taylor is hosting Saturday Night Live this week. The One Battle After Another -star is set as host for the first time on Saturday, Jan. 24. Additionally, the variety comedy show has musical guest Geese on the books. SNL broadcasts live on NBC with a start time of 11:30 p.m. ET/PT. Taylor, who is nominated for best supporting actress for the 98th Academy Awards, is having a great year so far after the success of One Battle After Another , while she co-stars in the action movie The Rip on Netflix. Although she’s not performing as musical guest on SNL this week, Teyana Taylor also released a hit album Escape Room during the summer of 2025. Meanwhile, indie art rock darlings Geese is set to perform as musical guest. The band is coming off the release of their critically-acclaimed album Getting Killed , while 2026 is positioned to be a big year for the Brooklyn-based band. Want to watch SNL online without cable and for frâ€¦

items.title: Brook criticises 'worst ever' pitch after ODI win
items.summary: England captain Harry Brook says the pitch used for the second one-day international against Sri Lanka in Colombo was "probably the worst" he's played on.

items.title: Kane draws blank as Bayern suffer first Bundesliga loss
items.summary: Bayern Munich's 27-game unbeaten run in the Bundesliga comes to an abrupt end as struggling Augsburg produce a shock victory at the Allianz Arena.

items.title: 'Beth Mead loves big games' - pundits on player of the match
items.summary: BBC Sport pundits Fara Williams and Ellen White discuss Beth Mead's "technically gifted" performance and how she "steps up in big moments" as Arsenal beat Chelsea in the Women's Super League.

items.title: Root's 75 helps England level ODI series in Sri Lanka
items.summary: Joe Root makes a measured 75 as England pull off a comfortable run chase to beat Sri Lanka by five wickets in the second one-day international.

items.title: 'The title race is probably over' - Bompastor on Chelsea defeat
items.summary: Chelsea manager Sonia Bompastor says she knows the "title race is gone" but her side "will never give up" following defeat by Arsenal at Stamford Bridge.

items.title: Scotland replace Bangladesh at T20 World Cup
items.summary: Bangladesh decide to boycott next month's T20 World Cup and their place at the tournament will be taken by Scotland.

items.title: Mead and Caldentey star as Arsenal triumph over Chelsea
items.summary: Beth Mead puts Arsenal in front in the 55th minute before Mariona Caldentey completes a 2-0 victory for the Gunners at Stamford Bridge.

items.title: Becky G Celebrates Selena and Isabel Allende in â€˜Celebrity Substituteâ€™ & More Uplifting Moments in LatinÂ Music
items.summary: Plus, Mon Laferte, Lunay, Santos Bravos, Feid & More Latin Stars Shine at Willy ChavarrÃ­a's Paris Fashion Week Show.
items.body: From career milestones to new music releases to major announcements and those little important moments,  Billboard  editors highlight uplifting moments in Latin music. Hereâ€™s what happened in the Latin music world this week. Becky G Inspires Schoolchildren in Celebrity Substitute In a new episode of Celebrity Substitute , Becky G visited Dos Puentes Elementary School in Washington Heights, New York, for Career Day. She delivered a lesson on identity and highlighted Latina heroes like writer and activist Isabel Allende, space engineer Diana Trujillo, and the late superstar Selena, while exploring what it truly means to shine. “A lot of times society tells us who we are supposed to be,” Becky G tells the host Julian Shapiro-Barnum during the episode. “When we’re young, we have this genuine belief that we can be whatever we want to be.” The 16-minute video wraps up with a special music video featuring the singer and her class, highlighting the Career Day theme. Previous celebrity substitutes have included Rauw Alejandro and Camila Cabello. Becky G is currently promoting her new documentary, Rebecca . Mon Laferte, Lunay & More Latin Stars Shâ€¦

items.title: Foo Fighters Set for One-Off Tasmania Return With Launceston StadiumÂ Gig
items.summary: The Launceston date is Foo Fightersâ€™ only Australian show scheduled for 2026 so far.
items.body: Foo Fighters are set to return to Tasmania this weekend for a one-off sold-out stadium show in Launceston, marking the bandâ€™s first performance in the Apple Isle in more than a decade and their first-ever concert in the northern Tasmanian city. The American rock group will play UTAS Stadium on Saturday, Jan. 24, with Frontier Touring and the band sharing a detailed â€œKnow Before You Goâ€ guide on Thursday (Jan. 22) outlining key information for ticketholders ahead of the sold-out event. â€œTASMANIA!!! KNOW BEFORE YOU GO,â€ the band wrote while resharing the promoterâ€™s post on social media. â€œSEE YOU SOONâ€¦â€ The Launceston date is Foo Fightersâ€™ only Australian show scheduled for 2026 so far and comes after tickets sold out rapidly during the general on-sale, with fans travelling from across the country to secure entry. No additional dates have been announced. The concert will be all-ages, with all attendees requiring a valid ticket regardless of age. Entry will be digital-only, with tickets accessible via mobile devices. Doors at UTAS Stadium are set to open at 5 p.m., with the show scheduled to begin at 6:20 p.m. Foo Fighters will be joined on the night by special guests Full Flower Moonâ€¦

items.title: Hilltop Hoods Edge Past Billie Eilish in triple j Hottest 100Â History
items.summary: Hilltop Hoods have been fixtures of the Hottest 100 since the early 2000s.
items.body: Australian hip-hop heavyweights Hilltop Hoods have reclaimed a long-held triple j Hottest 100 record from Billie Eilish . As results rolled in throughout the annual broadcast on Saturday (Jan. 25), the Adelaide hip-hop trioâ€™s latest entries pushed them ahead of Eilish on the tally, marking another milestone in the groupâ€™s enduring relationship with Australiaâ€™s most influential listener-voted chart. Hilltop Hoods have been fixtures of the Hottest 100 since the early 2000s, with songs spanning multiple eras of their career consistently finding favour with triple j voters. Their sustained presence across decades places them among a small group of Australian acts to repeatedly chart in the countdown, reflecting both their crossover appeal and deep-rooted connection to local audiences. Eilish, by contrast, has built her Hottest 100 footprint in a far shorter time frame, racking up entries since her breakout years and becoming one of the most successful international artists in the pollâ€™s recent history. Her run has been emblematic of triple jâ€™s increasingly global scope, particularly as streaming-driven pop and alternative releases have come to dominate recent countdowns. The moment alâ€¦

items.title: BTS Arirang World Tour DreamÂ Setlist
items.summary: While we're expecting loads of new tracks from the group's upcoming ARIRANG album, these are the super hits we're hoping to hear when the guys hit stadiums around the globe.
items.body: BTS ‘ forthcoming Arirang World Tour is arriving as a truly historic live trek for the pop royalty that is the Bangtan Boys â€” and it requires a monumental setlist to accompany it. Originally announced with 79 shows across 34 regions in five continents, the tour has already grown in its initial size with two additional U.S. dates added in both Tampa, Florida, and Stanford, California, as the first tickets went on sale this week. The group will things kick off in Goyang, South Korea, on April 9, 2026, and continue throughout 2027 with additional cities said to soon be announced in Japan, the Middle East and beyond. Related BTS Announces Massive Global Tour: Here Are the Dates The Arirang World Tour marks BTS’ first live concert series since the Permission to Dance on Stage tour that held mini-residencies in Seoul, Los Angeles and Las Vegas in 2021 and 2022 with 22 songs in the main setlist and three songs in the encore. During the period where members handled their individual mandatory military services, BTS members Suga , J-Hope and Jin managed to embark on their own solo tours. Suga embarked on his D-Day Tour across North America and Asia in 2023 before his militaâ€¦

items.title: Every Album Certified Double Diamond by the RIAA: FullÂ List
items.summary: To think, the RIAA didn't have a sales award higher than gold until 1976.
items.body: UPDATE (Jan. 23): The Eagles got a double dose of good news on Jan. 22, when the Recording Industry Association of America re-certified their 1976 compilation Eagles/Their Greatest Hits 1971-1975 , at the 40 million level and their subsequent studio album Hotel California at the 28 million level. The greatest-hits album was already No. 1 on our list of albums that have been certified Double Diamond or better by the RIAA. The latest upgrade allowed Hotel California to move up from No. 4 to No. 3 on the list. Related Eagles’ ‘Greatest Hits’ Is First Album to Be Certified Quadruple Diamond by RIAA PREVIOUSLY (Dec. 5. 2025): Metallica celebrated a major career milestone in May, when their 1991 album Metallica was certified Double Diamond by the Recording Industry Association of America (RIAA). It was just the 14th album to reach that plateau , which signifies shipments of 20 million albums (or streaming equivalent units) in the U.S. Double Diamond albums were unthinkable when the RIAA launched its gold awards program in 1958. Only one album was certified gold that year (signifying $1 million in manufacturerâ€™s dollar volume; the criteria later changed) â€“ the sounâ€¦

items.title: Pharrell Williams Sued by Neptunes Partner Chad Hugo Amid Split: â€˜Fraudulent Conductâ€™
items.summary: The former musical duo, which produced some of the biggest hits of the 2000s, is headed to court over accusations of unpaid royalties and "self-dealing."
items.body: Pharrell Williams is facing a lawsuit from his former Neptunes partner Chad Hugo , who claims his longtime friend has cut him out of their company and owes him as much as $1 million from an N.E.R.D. album. Before Pharrell became a solo superstar, he and Hugo formed a prolific songwriting duo for years, producing massive hits like Nellyâ€™s â€œHot in Herre,â€ Snoop Doggâ€™s â€œDrop It Like Itâ€™s Hot,â€ Gwen Stefaniâ€™s â€œHollaback Girlâ€ and Justin Timberlakeâ€™s â€œRock Your Body.â€ They also formed two-thirds of N.E.R.D., a hip-hop/rock band that enjoyed its own run of hit albums in the 2000s and 2010s. But in a strongly-worded lawsuit filed Friday (Jan. 23), Hugo accuses Williams â€” his friend since their Virginia childhoods â€” of committing a wide range of legal wrongdoing against his former partner. â€œWilliams engaged in self-dealing, concealed material information, and â€¦ diverted revenues owed to plaintiff,â€ writes Hugoâ€™s attorney, Brent J. Lehman of the law firm Munck Wilson Mandala. â€œSuch willful, fraudulent, and malicious conduct warrants the imposition of punitive damages.â€ Fridayâ€™s lawsuit, obtained and first reported by Billboard , isnâ€™t the first legal battle between the two collaborators. Bâ€¦

items.title: NASA Sets Briefings for SpaceX Crew-12 Mission to Space Station
items.summary: NASA and its partners will discuss the upcoming crew rotation to the International Space Station during a pair of news conferences on Friday, Jan. 30, from the agencyâ€™s Johnson Space Center in Houston. At 11 a.m. EST, mission leadership will discuss final launch and mission preparations in a news câ€¦
items.body: NASAâ€™s SpaceX Crew-12 crew, from left to right, is NASA astronauts Jessica Meir and Jack Hathaway, ESA (European Space Agency) astronaut Sophie Adenot, and Roscosmos cosmonaut Andrey Fedyaev. Credit: SpaceX NASA and its partners will discuss the upcoming crew rotation to the International Space Station during a pair of news conferences on Friday, Jan. 30, from the agencyâ€™s Johnson Space Center in Houston. At 11 a.m. EST, mission leadership will discuss final launch and mission preparations in a news conference that will stream on the agencyâ€™s YouTube channel. Next, the crew of NASAâ€™s SpaceX Crew-12 mission will participate in a virtual news conference from NASA Johnson crew quarters at 1 p.m., also on the agencyâ€™s YouTube channel. Individual streams for each of the events will be available on that page. This is the final media opportunity with Crew-12 before they travel to NASAâ€™s Kennedy Space Center in Florida for launch. Crew-12 will carry NASA astronauts Jessica Meir and Jack Hathaway , ESA (European Space Agency) astronaut Sophie Adenot, and Roscosmos cosmonaut Andrey Fedyaev to the orbiting laboratory. The crew will launch aboard a SpaceX Dragon spacecraft on the companyâ€™s Faâ€¦

items.title: NASA Awards Global Modeling, Assimilation Support Contract
items.summary: NASA has selected ADNET Systems, Inc. of Bethesda, Maryland, to provide global modeling and data assimilation support at the agencyâ€™s Goddard Space Flight Center in Greenbelt, Maryland. The Global Modeling and Assimilation Support contract is a single-award, cost-plus-fixed-fee, indefinite-deliveryâ€¦
items.body: Credit: NASA NASA has selected ADNET Systems, Inc. of Bethesda, Maryland, to provide global modeling and data assimilation support at the agencyâ€™s Goddard Space Flight Center in Greenbelt, Maryland. The Global Modeling and Assimilation Support contract is a single-award, cost-plus-fixed-fee, indefinite-delivery/indefinite-quantity contract with a maximum ordering value of approximately $84 million with a five-year period of performance beginning March 15, 2026. Under this contract, the contractor will be responsible for supporting and maintaining NASA Goddardâ€™s Global Modeling and Assimilation Officeâ€™s Goddard Earth Observing System (GEOS) model and data assimilation system. Tasks include supporting the development and validation of individual model components within GEOS and the development and integration of external components like sea and land-ice models within the modeling and assimilation system. For information about NASA and other agency programs, visit: https://www.nasa.gov -end- Tiernan Doyle Headquarters, Washington 202-358-1600 tiernan.doyle@nasa.gov Rob Garner Goddard Space Flight Center, Greenbelt, Md. 301-286-5687 rob.garner@nasa.gov Share Details Last Updated Jan 2â€¦

items.title: NASA Selects Participants to Track Artemis II Mission
items.summary: NASA has selected 34 global volunteers to track the Orion spacecraft during the crewed Artemis II missionâ€™s journey around the Moon. The Artemis II test flight will launch NASAâ€™s Space Launch System (SLS) rocket, carrying the Orion spacecraft and a crew of four astronauts, on a mission into deep spâ€¦
items.body: 4 Min Read NASA Selects Participants to Track Artemis II Mission A visual representation of NASA’s Artemis I mission. Credits: NASA NASA has selected 34 global volunteers to track the Orion spacecraft during the crewed Artemis II missionâ€™s journey around the Moon. The Artemis II test flight will launch NASAâ€™s Space Launch System (SLS) rocket, carrying the Orion spacecraft and a crew of four astronauts, on a mission into deep space. The agencyâ€™s second mission in the Artemis campaign is a key step in NASAâ€™s path toward establishing a long-term presence at the Moon and confirming the systems needed to support future lunar surface exploration and paving the way for the first crewed mission to Mars. While NASAâ€™s Near Space Network and Deep Space Network , coordinated by the agencyâ€™s SCaN (Space Communication and Navigation) program , will provide primary communications and tracking services to support Orionâ€™s launch, journey around the Moon, and return to Earth, participants selected from a request for proposals published in August 2025, comprised of established commercial service providers, members of academia, and individual amateur radio enthusiasts will use their respective â€¦

items.title: I Am Artemis: Dustin Gohmert
items.summary: Listen to this audio excerpt from Dustin Gohmert, Orion Crew Survival System (OCSS) manager: During NASAâ€™s Artemis II mission around the Moon, the astronauts inside the Orion spacecraft will be wearing specialized pressure suits designed to protect them throughout their journey. At NASAâ€™s Johnson Sâ€¦
items.body: 3 Min Read I Am Artemis: Dustin Gohmert Dustin Gohmert, Orion Crew Survival System (OCSS) manager, sits in the OCSS Lab at NASA’s Johnson Space Center in Houston. Credits: NASA/Rad Sinyak Listen to this audio excerpt from Dustin Gohmert, Orion Crew Survival System (OCSS) manager: 0:00 / 0:00 Your browser does not support the audio element. During NASAâ€™s Artemis II mission around the Moon, the astronauts inside the Orion spacecraft will be wearing specialized pressure suits designed to protect them throughout their journey. At NASAâ€™s Johnson Space Center in Houston, Dustin Gohmert leads the team responsible for these suits, known as the Orion Crew Survival System (OCSS). â€œWe work with the crew to say, â€˜Hereâ€™s this design concept we have. How does this really work in the spaceflight environment?â€™â€ Gohmert said. â€œAs we evolve the design, we take the crewâ€™s input and we adapt the suit over time to take into account not only the desire we have for safety, but the real-world impacts that it has.â€ The suits will protect astronauts on launch day, throughout high-risk parts of missions near the Moon, during the high-speed return to Earth, and in emergency situations if such events arâ€¦

items.title: Red, Green Light Show
items.summary: A green and red aurora streams across Earthâ€™s horizon above the city lights of Europe in this Jan. 19, 2026, photograph, which looks north across Italy toward Germany. The International Space Station was orbiting 262 miles above the Mediterranean Sea at approximately 10:02 p.m. local time when the â€¦
items.body: NASA/Chris Williams A green and red aurora streams across Earthâ€™s horizon above the city lights of Europe in this Jan. 19, 2026, photograph, which looks north across Italy toward Germany. The International Space Station was orbiting 262 miles above the Mediterranean Sea at approximately 10:02 p.m. local time when the image was captured. Also known as the northern lights ( aurora borealis ) or southern lights ( aurora australis ), auroras are colorful, dynamic, and often visually delicate displays of an intricate dance of particles and magnetism between the Sun and Earth called space weather. When energetic particles from space collide with atoms and molecules in the atmosphere, they can cause the colorful glow that we call auroras. Image credit: NASA/Chris Williams

items.title: NASA Finds Lunar Regolith Limits Meteorites as Source of Earthâ€™s Water
items.summary: A new NASA study of its Apollo lunar soils clarifies the Moonâ€™s record of meteorite impacts and timing of water delivery. These findings place upper bounds on how much water meteorites could have supplied later in Earthâ€™s history. Research has previously shown that meteorites may have been a signifâ€¦
items.body: 4 min read NASA Finds Lunar Regolith Limits Meteorites as Source of Earthâ€™s Water A close-up view of a portion of a â€œrelatively freshâ€ crater, looking southeast, as photographed during the third Apollo 15 lunar surface moonwalk. Credit: NASA A new NASA study of its Apollo lunar soils clarifies the Moonâ€™s record of meteorite impacts and timing of water delivery. These findings place upper bounds on how much water meteorites could have supplied later in Earthâ€™s history. Research has previously shown that meteorites may have been a significant source of Earthâ€™s water as they bombarded our planet early in the solar systemâ€™s development. In a paper published Tuesday in the Proceedings to the National Academy of Sciences, researchers led by Tony Gargano, a postdoctoral fellow at NASAâ€™s Johnson Space Center and the Lunar and Planetary Institute (LPI), both in Houston, used a novel method for analyzing the dusty debris that covers the Moonâ€™s surface called regolith . They learned that even under generous assumptions, meteorite delivery since about four billion years ago could only have supplied a small fraction of Earthâ€™s water. The Moon serves as an ancient archive of the impact history â€¦

items.title: NASAâ€™s Chandra Releases Deep Cut From Catalog of Cosmic Recordings
items.summary: Like a recording artist who has had a long career, NASAâ€™s Chandra X-ray Observatory has a â€œback catalogâ€ of cosmic recordings that is impossible to replicate. To access these X-ray tracks, or observations, the ultimate compendium has been developed: the Chandra Source Catalog (CSC). The CSC containâ€¦
items.body: 5 Min Read NASA’s Chandra Releases Deep Cut From Catalog of Cosmic Recordings Like a recording artist who has had a long career,  NASAâ€™s Chandra X-ray Observatory  has a â€œback catalogâ€ of cosmic recordings that is impossible to replicate. To access these X-ray tracks, or observations, the ultimate compendium has been developed: the  Chandra Source Catalog  (CSC). The CSC contains the  X-ray  data detected up to the end of 2020 by Chandra, the worldâ€™s premier X-ray telescope and one of NASAâ€™s â€œGreat Observatories.â€ The latest version of the CSC, known as CSC 2.1, contains over 400,000 unique compact and extended sources and over 1.3 million individual detections in X-ray light. before after This image contains lower-, medium-, and higher-energy X-rays in red, green, and blue respectively. NASA/CXC/SAO; Image Processing: NASA/CXC/SAO/N. Wolk This image is the sum of 86 observations added together, representing over three million seconds of Chandra observing time. It spans just about 60 light-years across, which is a veritable pinprick on the entire sky. The underlying image contains lower-, medium-, and higher-energy X-rays in red, green, and blueâ€¦

items.title: Journey to Center of Milky Way With Upcoming NASA Roman Core Survey
items.summary: At the heart of our own galaxy, there is a dense thicket of stars with a supermassive black hole at the very center. NASAâ€™s Nancy Grace Roman Space Telescope will provide the deepest-ever view of this zone, revealing stars, planets, and unique objects that resist definition. Based on the input of aâ€¦
items.body: At the heart of our own galaxy, there is a dense thicket of stars with a supermassive black hole at the very center. NASAâ€™s Nancy Grace Roman Space Telescope will provide the deepest-ever view of this zone, revealing stars, planets, and unique objects that resist definition. Based on the input of astronomers from across the globe, the Roman Space Telescope will spend three-quarters of its five-year primary mission conducting three revolutionary surveys of unprecedented scale. Their combined results will transform all areas of astronomy and answer longstanding questions about dark matter, dark energy, and planets outside of our solar system, called exoplanets. That last theme will be addressed by the Galactic Bulge Time-Domain Survey, which will peer into the center of our galaxy to study the stars and exoplanets that make up the densely populated region around the center of the Milky Way, known as the galactic bulge. This infographic describes the Galactic Bulge Time-Domain Survey that will be conducted by NASAâ€™s Nancy Grace Roman Space Telescope. The smallest of Romanâ€™s core surveys, this observation program will consist of repeat visits to six fields covering 1.7 square degrees â€¦

items.title: I've realised I can make a difference - Hoy
items.summary: In a new BBC documentary, Sir Chris Hoy shows how he is using his Olympic mindset to reframe his purpose following a terminal cancer diagnosis.

items.title: The man behind the headlines - Salah, by Klopp, Diaz and more
items.summary: BBC Sport explores Mohamed Salah's personality with help from the people who know him best.

items.title: Inside McLaren's season - the rules, values, incidents & relationships
items.summary: Intra-team title battles turn toxic far more often than not. Andrew Benson analyses how McLaren have maintained relative harmony between Lando Norris and Oscar Piastri.

items.title: England's AI World Cup masterplan - from perfecting penalties to powering players
items.summary: BBC Sport hears from inside the England setup about how artificial intelligence is powering plans for next summer's World Cup.
